title: C04-1036

sentences.text: We suggest a new goal and evaluation criterion for word similarity measures .

The new criterion -- meaning-entailing substitutability -- fits the needs of semantic-oriented NLP applications and can be evaluated directly -LRB- independent of an application -RRB- at a good level of human agreement .

Motivated by this semantic criterion we analyze the empirical quality of distributional word feature vectors and its impact on word similarity results , proposing an objective measure for evaluating feature vector quality .
Finally , a novel feature weighting and selection function is presented , which yields superior feature vectors and better word similarity performance .

Entity-meaning-entailing_substitutabilit.label: meaning-entailing substitutability
Entity-meaning-entailing_substitutabilit.description: A semantic criterion for evaluating word similarity measures, which assesses whether two words can be substituted with each other in a sentence without changing its meaning.

aliases: an objective measure for evaluating feature vector quality
Entity-an_objective_measure_for_evaluati.description: A proposed metric used to assess the quality of feature vectors representing words in a way that is independent of specific NLP applications.

summary: We suggest a new goal and evaluation criterion for word similarity measures . The new criterion -- meaning-entailing substitutability -- fits the needs of semantic-oriented NLP applications and can be evaluated directly -LRB- independent of an application -RRB- at a good level of human agreement . Motivated by this semantic criterion we analyze the empirical quality of distributional word feature vectors and its impact on word similarity results , proposing an objective measure for evaluating feature vector quality . Finally , a novel feature weighting and selection function is presented , which yields superior feature vectors and better word similarity performance .

Predicate-suggests_a_new_goal_and_evalua.label: suggests a new goal and evaluation criterion for
Predicate-suggests_a_new_goal_and_evalua.description: This predicate indicates that the subject proposes or recommends a novel objective and corresponding assessment standard for evaluating the object. The connection between the subject and object is one of proposing an alternative framework, guideline, or approach to assess or measure something.

Predicate-fits.label: fits
Predicate-fits.description: Indicates that a subject has a property or characteristic that matches or corresponds to an object. The predicate 'fits' suggests a sense of congruence, compatibility, or suitability between the subject and the object.

Predicate-fits_the_needs_of_semantic-ori.label: fits the needs of semantic-oriented NLP applications
Predicate-fits_the_needs_of_semantic-ori.description: Indicates that a subject meets or satisfies the requirements and expectations of semantic-oriented natural language processing (NLP) applications.

Predicate-propose.label: propose
Predicate-propose.description: To suggest or recommend something as a potential solution, approach, or standard to be considered and evaluated.

Predicate-analyzes_the_empirical_quality.label: analyzes the empirical quality of distributional word feature vectors and its impact on
Predicate-analyzes_the_empirical_quality.description: Evaluates the reliability or accuracy of a method that represents words as numerical features (vectors), examining how well these representations capture relationships between words and their impact on downstream applications.

Predicate-proposing.label: proposing
Predicate-proposing.description: Proposing connects a subject to an object by suggesting or putting forward something as a potential solution, idea, or approach. It implies that the subject is offering or presenting the object as a viable option for consideration.

Predicate-is_presented.label: is presented
Predicate-is_presented.description: The predicate 'is presented' indicates that a concept or idea (subject) is introduced, explained, or made available to others through some medium or representation (object). It suggests a formal or informal presentation of information, which can take various forms such as an explanation, demonstration, illustration, or example.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject concept is a specific instance or subclass of the object concept. It represents an is-a relationship, where the subject is more precise and detailed than the object.
